cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana to Mississippi/Alabama coast), then turning northwest into the lower Mississippi Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the MS/AL border – east of the mouth of the Pearl River

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: No coastal or inland watches presently in effect for Louisiana west of the Pearl River.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Okaloosa-Walton County Line FL westward to east of Morgan City LA, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 35–45 mph winds with higher gusts possible Tuesday night through Wednesday as the storm’s western semicircle brushes the Baton Rouge area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minimal; surge along the lower Mississippi River expected to be 1–2 ft and should not translate into significant river rise at Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–6 inches with isolated 8 inch totals, producing localized flash-flooding that may disrupt port and landside access.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in feeder bands and possible river level rises from upstream rainfall could affect cargo handling and ground transport.
